acceptance_tests: The game can be launched and played by a user
Tetromino pieces spawn, move, rotate, and lock according to Tetris rules
Completed lines are detected and cleared
The game ends when no more pieces can be placed
goal: Design and create a new implementation of the game Tetris.
open_questions: What platform should the game target (web, mobile, desktop, console)?
What programming language or technology stack is required?
Should this follow classic Tetris rules strictly or allow rule variations?
Is this a single-player experience only or should multiplayer be supported?
What level of graphical fidelity is expected (minimal, 2D, 3D)?
recommendations: Start with a reference implementation of classic Tetris mechanics
Define a clear separation between game logic, rendering, and input handling
Document architectural decisions due to the critical nature of the work

can: Introduce enhancements or modernizations beyond classic Tetris
Support extensibility for future features or modes
must: Create a playable game named Tetris
Provide a complete game experience from start to game over
should: Follow recognizable Tetris rules and behaviors
Be architected in a clean, maintainable way suitable for critical system design work
